types.name: AddCartItemsInput
types.description: Input for the `addCartItems` mutation

inputFields.name: cartId
inputFields.description: The cart ID

inputFields.name: cartToken
inputFields.description: If this cart is anonymous, provide the `cartToken` that was returned in the `CreateCartPayload`

inputFields.name: clientMutationId
inputFields.description: An optional string identifying the mutation call, which will be returned in the response payload

inputFields.name: items
inputFields.description: Array of items to be added to the cart

types.name: AddCartItemsPayload
types.description: The payload returned from the `addCartItems` mutation call

fields.name: cart
fields.description:
The modified cart. You should check `incorrectPriceFailures` and `minOrderQuantityFailures` for
information necessary to display errors to the shopper. Some items may not have been added.

fields.name: clientMutationId
fields.description: The same string you sent with the mutation params, for matching mutation calls with their responses

fields.name: incorrectPriceFailures
fields.description:
Clients should check to see if any items failed to be added due to the price not matching the current price.
In general, a user interface should display the correct current prices to the shopper, confirm that they still
want to add the items, and then call `createCart` or `addCartItems` to do so.

Note that this field will always exist but may be an empty array if there were no failures of this type.

fields.name: minOrderQuantityFailures
fields.description:
Clients should check to see if any items failed to be added due to quantity being below the minimum order
quantity defined for the product variant. In general, a user interface should display the minimum order
quantity to the shopper and allow them to add that quantity or greater.

Note that this field will always exist but may be an empty array if there were no failures of this type.

types.name: Cart
types.description: The cart holds selected items until order is placed.

fields.name: _id
fields.description: The Cart ID

fields.name: account
fields.description:
The account that owns the cart. Some carts are created for anonymous users. Anonymous carts have a null account.
Every account has exactly one cart per shop.

fields.name: checkout
fields.description: Holds all information collected for a cart during checkout

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time at which the cart was created, which is when the first item was added to it.

fields.name: email
fields.description: An email address that has been associated with the cart

fields.name: expiresAt
fields.description: The date and time at which the cart will expire. Account carts usually do not expire, so they will have a null value here.

fields.name: items
fields.description: The items that have been added to the cart. A cart is not created until the first item is added. Items can be removed from a cart, and a cart is not deleted if all items are removed from it. Because all items may have been removed, this may be an empty array.

args.name: after
args.description: Return only results that come after this cursor. Use this with `first` to specify the number of results to return.

args.name: before
args.description: Return only results that come before this cursor. Use this with `last` to specify the number of results to return.

args.name: first
args.description: Return at most this many results. This parameter may be used with either `after` or `offset` parameters.

args.name: last
args.description: Return at most this many results. This parameter may be used with the `before` parameter.

args.name: offset
args.description: Return only results that come after the Nth result. This parameter may be used with the `first` parameter.

args.name: sortBy
args.description: By default, items are sorted by when they were added to the cart, newest first. Set this to sort by one of the other allowed fields

args.name: sortOrder
args.description: Return results sorted in this order

fields.name: missingItems
fields.description:
If any products or variants become hidden or are deleted after they were added to this cart, they'll be
automatically moved from `items` to `missingItems`. Clients may want to use this to show an
"items that are no longer available" list to storefront users.

If a product becomes visible again, the item will never be automatically moved from `missingItems`
back to `items`, but clients may want to provide a way for users to manually do this.

fields.name: referenceId
fields.description:
If you integrate with third-party systems that require you to send the same ID for order
calculations as for cart calculations, you may use this ID, which is the same on a `cart` as on
the `order` placed from that cart. This ID can also be customized by plugins and is the best
ID to use if it is necessary to show a cart ID in the user interface.

fields.name: shop
fields.description: The shop that owns the cart.

fields.name: surcharges

types.name: CatalogProductVariant
types.description: A variant of a catalog product

fields.name: _id
fields.description: The CatalogProductVariant ID. Do not assume that this is the same as the related variant ID. See `variantId` for that.

fields.name: attributeLabel
fields.description:
The attribute label describes the category of variant, for example, `Color` or `Size`.
In most cases this will be the same for all variants at the same level.

fields.name: barcode
fields.description: The product variant barcode value, if it has one

fields.name: canBackorder
fields.description:
True for a purchasable variant if an order containing this variant will be accepted even when there is insufficient
available inventory (`inventoryAvailableToSell`) to fulfill it immediately. For non-purchasable variants, this is true if at least one purchasable
child variant can be backordered. A storefront UI may use this in combination with `inventoryAvailableToSell` to
decide whether to show or enable an "Add to Cart" button.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time at which this CatalogProductVariant was created, which is when the related product was first published

fields.name: height
fields.description: The height of the product variant, if it has physical dimensions

fields.name: index
fields.description: The position of this variant among other variants at the same level of the product-variant-option hierarchy

fields.name: inventoryAvailableToSell
fields.description:
The quantity of this item currently available to sell.
This number is updated when an order is placed by the customer.
This number does not include reserved inventory (i.e. inventory that has been ordered, but not yet processed by the operator).
If this is a variant, this number is created by summing all child option inventory numbers.
This is most likely the quantity to display in the storefront UI.

fields.name: inventoryInStock
fields.description:
The quantity of this item currently in stock.
This number is updated when an order is processed by the operator.
This number includes all inventory, including reserved inventory (i.e. inventory that has been ordered, but not yet processed by the operator).
If this is a variant, this number is created by summing all child option inventory numbers.
This is most likely just used as a reference in the operator UI, and not displayed in the storefront UI.

fields.name: isBackorder
fields.description:
True for a purchasable variant if it is sold out but allows backorders. For non-purchasable variants, this is
true if every purchasable child variant is sold out but allows backorders. A storefront UI may use this
to decide to show a "Backordered" indicator.

fields.name: isLowQuantity
fields.description:
True for a purchasable variant if it has a low available quantity (`inventoryAvailableToSell`) in stock.
For non-purchasable variants, this is true if at least one purchasable child variant has a low available
quantity in stock. A storefront UI may use this to decide to show a "Low Quantity" indicator.

fields.name: isSoldOut
fields.description:
True for a purchasable variant if it is sold out (`inventoryAvailableToSell` is 0). For non-purchasable
variants, this is true if every purchasable child variant is sold out. A storefront UI may use this
to decide to show a "Sold Out" indicator when `isBackorder` is not also true.

fields.description: Is sales tax charged on this item?

fields.description: All media for this variant / option

fields.name: cart
fields.description:
The created cart, if at least one item could be added. Otherwise null, and you should check
`incorrectPriceFailures` and `minOrderQuantityFailures` for information necessary to display
errors to the shopper.

fields.name: clientMutationId
fields.description: The same string you sent with the mutation params, for matching mutation calls with their responses

fields.name: incorrectPriceFailures
fields.description:
Clients should check to see if any items failed to be added due to the price not matching the current price.
In general, a user interface should display the correct current prices to the shopper, confirm that they still
want to add the items, and then call `createCart` or `addCartItems` to do so.

Note that this field will always exist but may be an empty array if there were no failures of this type.

fields.name: minOrderQuantityFailures
fields.description:
Clients should check to see if any items failed to be added due to quantity being below the minimum order
quantity defined for the product variant. In general, a user interface should display the minimum order
quantity to the shopper and allow them to add that quantity or greater.

Note that this field will always exist but may be an empty array if there were no failures of this type.

fields.name: token
fields.description:
If no identity token is provided with the request, then this mutation will create an anonymous cart. All
anonymous carts have a token associated with them, which allows the client that created the cart to access
that cart in the future. This is the only time this token is returned, so clients must store this securely
in some type of local storage solution, and then send it along with all future anonymous cart queries and
mutations.

fields.name: compareAtPrice
fields.description:
A comparison price value, usually MSRP. If `price` is null, this will also be null. That is,
only purchasable variants will have a `compareAtPrice`.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The code for the currency these pricing details applies to

fields.name: displayPrice
fields.description:
UI should display this price. If a product has multiple potential prices depending on selected
variants and options, then this is a price range string such as "$3.95 - $6.99". It includes the currency
symbols.

fields.name: maxPrice
fields.description: The price of the most expensive possible variant+option combination

fields.name: minPrice
fields.description: The price of the least expensive possible variant+option combination

fields.name: price
fields.description:
For variants with no options and for options, this will always be set to a price. For variants
with options and products, this will be `null`. There must be a price for a variant to be
added to a cart or purchased. Otherwise you would instead add one of its child options to a cart.

Use this mutation to cancel one item of an order, either for the full ordered quantity
or for a partial quantity. If partial, the item will be split into two items and the
original item will have a lower quantity and will be canceled.

If this results in all items in a fulfillment group being canceled, the group will also
be canceled. If this results in all fulfillment groups being canceled, the full order will
also be canceled.

Clients should call this as necessary during checkout to update the `availableFulfillmentOptions`
property for all fulfillment groups of the cart with fresh price quotes. These need to be
recalculated every time the items in that group change. When the order is placed, the chosen
option for each group will have its prices recalculated one last time. If the prices do not match,
order creation will fail.

creating a cart. If you do have a cart, there are two good reasons to provide this. First, it serves as a
reference. Second, it allows the Cart service to automatically delete the related cart after the order is

we recommend that you use their "orders" email address, if they have one, or their default email address.

One or more fulfillment groups for the order. These are the actual orders that need to be fulfilled,
separate by shop, fulfillment type, and shipping origin or destination.

The shop through which the order should be placed. Payment settings from this shop will be used. Note that
each fulfillment group also has a shop ID, which represents the shop that needs to fulfill that part of the
order, and those shop IDs may or may not match this one.

types.name: ProductVariantInput

inputFields.name: _id
inputFields.description:
Any string to use as the internal ID for a new variant. Do not prefix or base64 encode this ID.
This field is allowed only when creating a variant. If you include an ID for an update, you
will get an error. The string must also be different from any existing product, variant, or
option internal ID or you will get a duplicate ID error. If you do not include this when creating
a variant, a random unique string is generated for you.

inputFields.name: attributeLabel
inputFields.description:
The attribute label describes the category of variant, for example, `Color` or `Size`.
In most cases this will be the same for all variants at the same level.

inputFields.name: barcode
inputFields.description: The product variant barcode value, if it has one

inputFields.name: compareAtPrice
inputFields.description: Variant compareAtPrice. DEPRECATED. Use the `updateProductVariantPrices` mutation to set product variant prices.

inputFields.name: height
inputFields.description: The height of the product variant, if it has physical dimensions

inputFields.name: index
inputFields.description: The position of this variant among other variants at the same level of the product-variant-option hierarchy

inputFields.name: isDeleted
inputFields.description: True if this variant was deleted. Deleted variants are not published to the catalog.

inputFields.name: isTaxable
inputFields.description: Whether this variant is taxable

inputFields.name: isVisible
inputFields.description: True if this variant is visible. Hidden variants are not published to the catalog.

inputFields.description: The length of the product, if it has physical dimensions

inputFields.description: Arbitrary additional metadata about this product

types.name: ShopSettings
types.description:
App settings for a specific shop. Plugins extend the ShopSettings type to support
whatever settings they need.

fields.name: canSellVariantWithoutInventory
fields.description:
If there is no known inventory for a product configuration, this setting determines
whether that product configuration can be sold and should appear to be available.

fields.name: defaultTaxCode
fields.description: The default value to use for `taxCode` property of a product

fields.name: doNotUse
fields.description: A fake setting necessary until some plugin extends this with a real setting

fields.name: fallbackTaxServiceName
fields.description:
The name of the tax service to fall back to if the primary tax service is down.
This will match the `name` field of one of the services returned by the `taxServices`
query.

fields.name: isShippingRatesFulfillmentEnabled
fields.description:
If `false` no defined shipping rates will be used when fulfillment
quotes are requested for a cart or order. A quick way to disable the entire
`reaction-shipping-rates` plugin temporarily.

fields.name: primaryTaxServiceName
fields.description:
The name of the tax service to use for calculating taxes on carts and orders.
This will match the `name` field of one of the services returned by the `taxServices`
query.

fields.name: shouldNavigationTreeItemsBeAdminOnly
fields.description:
Whether a navigation item added to the navigation tree should be visible only to
admins by default.

fields.name: shouldNavigationTreeItemsBePubliclyVisible
fields.description:
Whether a navigation item added to the navigation tree should be
public API/Storefront visible by default.

fields.name: shouldNavigationTreeItemsBeSecondaryNavOnly
fields.description:
Whether a navigation item added to the navigation tree should be a secondary
navigation item by default.

fields.name: sitemapRefreshPeriod
fields.description: This setting controls how often the sitemaps for the shop will be rebuilt

types.name: ShopSettingsUpdates
types.description:
Updates for app settings that are not shop specific. Plugins extend
this input type to support whatever settings they need. All fields
must be optional.

inputFields.name: canSellVariantWithoutInventory
inputFields.description:
If there is no known inventory for a product configuration, this setting determines
whether that product configuration can be sold and should appear to be available.

inputFields.name: defaultTaxCode
inputFields.description: The default value to use for `taxCode` property of a product

inputFields.name: doNotUse
inputFields.description: Do not use this field

inputFields.name: fallbackTaxServiceName
inputFields.description:
Optionally, set the name of the tax service to fall back to if the primary tax service is down.
This must match the `name` field of one of the services returned by the `taxServices` query.

inputFields.name: isShippingRatesFulfillmentEnabled
inputFields.description:
Set to `false` to prevent any defined shipping rates from being used when fulfillment
quotes are requested for a cart or order. A quick way to disable the entire
`reaction-shipping-rates` plugin temporarily.

inputFields.name: primaryTaxServiceName
inputFields.description:
Set the name of the tax service to use for calculating taxes on carts and orders.
This will match the `name` field of one of the services returned by the `taxServices`
query. There will be no taxes charged for any carts or orders if this is not set.

inputFields.name: shouldNavigationTreeItemsBeAdminOnly
inputFields.description:
Whether a navigation item added to the navigation tree should be visible only to
admins by default.

inputFields.name: shouldNavigationTreeItemsBePubliclyVisible
inputFields.description:
Whether a navigation item added to the navigation tree should be
public API/Storefront visible by default.

inputFields.name: shouldNavigationTreeItemsBeSecondaryNavOnly
inputFields.description:
Whether a navigation item added to the navigation tree should be a secondary
navigation item by default.

inputFields.name: sitemapRefreshPeriod
inputFields.description: This setting controls how often the sitemaps for the shop will be rebuilt

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.
